intro: Clermontia clermontioides var. barbata, commonly known as the hairy clermontia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in native forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
